timeline.description: The term 'artificial intelligence' is coined at the Dartmouth Conference, marking the birth of AI as a field.
Joseph Weizenbaum develops ELIZA, an early natural language processing program that simulates conversation.
SHRDLU, a natural language understanding program, is developed by Terry Winograd, demonstrating the ability to understand and manipulate objects in a virtual world.
The rise of expert systems, which use AI to mimic the decision-making abilities of a human expert, begins.
IBM's Deep Blue defeats world chess champion Garry Kasparov, showcasing the power of AI in strategic games.
IBM Watson wins the quiz show Jeopardy!, demonstrating advanced natural language processing and machine learning capabilities.
Google DeepMind's AlphaGo defeats Go champion Lee Sedol, marking a significant milestone in AI's ability to handle complex games.
OpenAI releases GPT-3, a state-of-the-art language processing AI that can generate human-like text.
AI technologies become integrated into everyday applications, impacting various sectors including healthcare, finance, and transportation.
